SENT.plain: We present a patient and his maternal uncle who have a subaortic ventricular septal defect and aortic root dilation
They both have physical anomalies, characteristic behaviors, and cognitive disabilities that are consistent with the diagnosis of Lujan-Fryns syndrome (LFS)
Although there have been 4 cases reported in the literature with heart findings, ventricular septal defect and aortic root dilation have not been previously reported in LFS
Differentiation between LFS and Marfan syndrome (MS) is discussed
The pathophysiology of LFS as a connective tissue disorder is also considered
